intro: Chiliotrichum fuegianum, commonly known as the Fuegian starflower, is a flowering plant native to the southern Andes and Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its small, star-shaped flowers are usually white or pale blue, adding a delicate beauty to its habitat. Chiliotrichum fuegianum is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal.
